title: Corrections & Amplifications
description: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of Sept. 8, 2023

title: Head-Spinning Heat Hangs On
description: A swimmer in the British seaside resort of Brighton leaps into the English Channel on Thursday seeking relief from the higher-than-usual temperatures that continue to bake the U.K. and the Continent late into the summer. Photo: Daniel Leal/Agence France-Presse/Getty Images

title: Flexport Clears Out Executives After Clark's Resignation as CEO
description: Flexport founder Ryan Petersen is cleaning house after Dave Clark, a former top executive at Amazon.com, abruptly resigned as chief executive of the freight forwarder following disagreements over the direction of the business and spending on new operations.

title: Biden Freezes U.S. Arctic Oil
description: Interior Secretary Deb Haaland relies on ‘Indigenous Knowledge’ as a legal justification to block drilling. No joke.

title: Biden's Age Problem Isn't Going Away
description: Is Kamala Harris ready for the big chair? Voters will inevitably ask.

title: New York's Migrant Meltdown
description: It’ll ‘destroy New York,’ the Mayor says. Then he blasts a Republican.

title: Texas Suffers a Solar and Wind Power 'Drought'
description: The Lone Star State barely avoids blackouts, thanks to natural gas.

title: Black Lung Is Resurging
description: Roughly one in five miners in the Central Appalachia coalfields of West Virginia, Kentucky and Virginia now have the devastating illness.

title: Telluride Film Festival Review: Climbing Cinema's Summit
description: Yorgos Lanthimos’s Emma Stone-starring “Poor Things,” Jonathan Glazer’s Auschwitz drama “The Zone of Interest” and Emerald Fennell’s wickedly imaginative “Saltburn” were among the highlights of this year’s iteration of the Colorado festival.

title: Notable & Quotable: Mayor Adams on Migrants
description: ‘I don’t see an ending to this. This issue will destroy New York City.’

title: Texas May Execute a Man Based on a Scrapped Medical Theory
description: Autistic father Robert Roberson was wrongfully convicted of murdering his 2-year-old daughter.

title: 'Welcome to Wrexham' Season 2 Review: Ryan Reynolds's Adventures in English Football
description: The star bought a struggling soccer team with Rob McElhenney in hopes of making it sustainable, and the affable FX documentary’s new season follows their continuing efforts to do so.

title: Biden Plays Disaster Politics
description: If he succeeds, the result would be truly catastrophic for the Republican Party.

title: Pious Agnosticism as a Form of Judaism
description: I’m not Orthodox or even Reform. I live comfortable with contradiction.

title: The Tuberville-Sanders Playbook
description: They’re stalling vital nominations at the Pentagon and NIH to score political points.

title: 'Son of the Old West' Review: Cowboy and Chronicler
description: First a cowhand, then a detective, then an author, Charlie Siringo crisscrossed the American West, collecting stories as he went.

title: 'The Swarm' Review: A Sci-Fi Sea of Troubles
description: Underwater creatures are on the attack in this CW series based on the novel by German author Frank Schätzing.

title: Biden's Fibs Are a 20th-Century Throwback
description: They’re cinematic, as befits a politician who came of age during Hollywood’s golden era.

title: New Jersey Veterans' Nursing Homes Gave Subpar Care, Violated Rights During Covid Outbreak
description: A Justice Department report released Thursday says the state didn’t do enough to investigate what went wrong. Gov. Phil Murphy says more work is needed.

title: A Curious Quran Burning in Sweden
description: A wave of anger from the Middle East is the result of an organized disinformation campaign.

title: SEC Probes Ryan Cohen's Bed Bath & Beyond Trades
description: The billionaire took a $120 million position in housewares retailer and then abruptly sold it.

title: 'Show Me': New Evidence Arises for the Origin of a Slogan About Proof
description: Let the record now show: A young Missourian competing in an 1890s bicycle race is the earliest person reported to use the state’s famous motto

title: College Football Just Went Down the Tubes
description: I stopped watching, and once your brain catches up to the new reality, you’ll stop too.

title: Covid Talk Returns---Will the Rules Follow?
description: I am so thankful we took the risk to see Mom, and I would do it all again.

title: Record Hacks on Hospitals Endanger Patients, Cyber Official Says
description: A record year for cyberattacks on U.S. hospitals is putting patients in danger, as hospitals struggle to cope with disabled equipment and frozen data, an official from the American Hospital Association warned.

title: 'Some Weird Freakish Thing'
description: Senators of both parties concoct a new budget scam.

title: Canada Rate Policy Might Be 'Sufficiently Restrictive,' Gov. Tiff Macklem Says
description: Bank of Canada Gov. Tiff Macklem said higher interest rates are suppressing consumption and dampening price increases, and might be at “sufficiently restrictive” levels for the central bank to achieve its 2% inflation target.

title: American Trapped Deep in Turkish Cave Sparks Rescue Mission
description: Rescuers are racing to save an American cave explorer who fell ill while inside one of Turkey’s deepest cave systems.

title: Trump's Trade Guru Convicted of Contempt for Refusing to Speak to Jan. 6 Committee
description: Peter Navarro draws quick verdict from jury in Washington federal court and has vowed to appeal on executive-privilege grounds.

title: S&P 500 Falls for Third Straight Session
description: Apple selloff continues, interest-rate worries loom.

title: Want to Up Your Style Game, Guys? Get a Silver Ring---Using These Guidelines
description: Cool takes on men’s signet, chain and surfer-y rings are plentiful now, but finding the right one can be surprisingly tricky. So pay attention to these four shopping truths.

title: Carlos Alcaraz Is Bringing the Thrill Back to Tennis
description: Barely out of his teens, the phenom made a blistering ascent to become the top-ranked player in the world—and has electrified fans as he defends his title at the U.S Open.

title: Guns and Ammunition Tax Passed by California Senate
description: An excise tax of 11% would be the first imposed by any state.

title: Oh, And One More Thing… (Friday Crossword, September 8)
Justice Kavanaugh Sees 'Concrete Steps' Ahead to Address Supreme Court Ethics
description: All nine justices want their “respect for the institution to be shared by the American people,” Kavanaugh told a conference.

title: Conspirator in Haitian Leader's Killing Pleads Guilty in Miami
description: A former Colombian colonel who organized a mercenary force will cooperate with U.S. investigators seeking to untangle the 2021 killing of Jovenel Moïse.

title: Apple's Stock Is Having a Rough Week
description: Shares of Apple fell, extending this week’s losses to more than 6%, in the wake of China ordering officials at some government agencies not to use iPhones at work.

title: 2024 Mazda CX-90 PHEV: A Slow Walk to the EV Revolution
description: For Mazda, electrification means hybridized gas-fired powertrains—like the CX-90 PHEV, a status-conscious hybrid for buyers who don’t want to rush into the future.

title: Tourists Behaving Badly
description: When today’s travelers get in trouble for knocking over statues or defacing temples, they’re following an obnoxious tradition that dates back to the Romans.

title: Canada Appoints Judge to Probe Allegations of Foreign Interference in Elections

description: A new study suggests delivery-app users can be gently persuaded to cut out three million metric tons of single-use cutlery a year.

title: Prospects for BOE Rate Pause Improve as Inflation Expectations Ease

description: The unions for more than 50,000 housekeepers, bartenders and other staff are seeking higher wages and an increase in on-the-job security protection.

title: Pennsylvania Manhunt for Escaped Murderer Enters Second Week
description: Police said they believed the manhunt and hot and humid weather had begun to take its toll on Danelo Cavalcante, who escaped on Aug. 31 from Chester County Prison.

title: College Students Have Always Wanted Freedom
description: Today’s undergraduates are often described as coddled and closed-minded, but the tradition of free thinking on campus is still alive—and universities can help to foster it.

description: You needn’t devote a whole rainy weekend day to spiffing up your personal library, say interior designers and stylists. Here, their quick fixes.

title: How the Tories Became Servants of the Welfare State
description: Their unwillingness to cut spending destroyed their image of competence. The GOP should take note.

title: Pushing Inflation to Fed Target Will Run Into Tight Labor Market, Researcher Says
description: A tight labor market is behind about half of the rise in inflation and the other half can be attached to pandemic-related supply factors, according to new research.

title: GM's Counteroffer to UAW Shows Big Gap Remains as Strike Deadline Looms
description: The automaker proposed a 10% wage increase, far short of the union’s 40% ask.

title: U.S. Crude-Oil and Gasoline Inventories Fall Sharply
description: Crude-oil stockpiles slid by a greater-than-expected 6.3 million barrels last week, government data showed, while gasoline stockpiles fell by 2.7 million barrels, also more than analysts expected.

title: You'll Want a Nutty, Spicy Sprinkle of This On Everything
description: The spice-and-nut mix dukkah—normally something savory—brings an element of surprise to this delicious dessert and other sweet treats. The recipe couldn’t be easier.

title: Couche-Tard Shares Slide After Profit Falls, Revenue Misses Expectations
description: Alimentation Couche-Tard’s shares slipped after the Canadian gas station and convenience store operator reported a drop in earnings for the latest quarter as revenue was squeezed by lower fuel sales.

title: His Friend Wagered He Couldn't Flip This $42.5 Million Megamansion. He's All In
description: The roughly 4,900-square-foot Malibu home is undergoing a massive renovation, and is about 50% complete.

description: Salame would be the fourth associate of FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried to plead guilty.

description: Revised compensation structure will allow for better staffing throughout stores, retailer says.

title: BlackBerry Shares Dive as Preliminary Revenue Estimates Miss Views
description: The Waterloo, Ontario-based security software company reported that preliminary second-quarter revenue would be $132 million, well below the $204.2 million forecast by analysts polled by FactSet, citing delays in the closing of certain deals.

description: A large network of pro-China accounts found on Facebook and Instagram has also burrowed into Gab.com, known for tolerance of hate speech.

description: A year and a half into its existence, Task Force KleptoCapture is looking beyond flashy assets such as yachts and planes as it seeks to shut down the network of facilitators that oligarchs rely on to move money.

title: An Elevator Expert Explains How to Move People Up 118 Floors, Fast
description: Malaysia’s Merdeka 118 will become the second tallest skyscraper in the world in 2024. An elevator engineer expert breaks down what’s involved in designing an elevator system that meets people’s expectations while also balancing cost and space.

title: Meta's New Ad Campaign Reminds People That VR Is Already Here
description: New ads from Meta Platforms replace earlier campaigns’ visions of a futuristic metaverse with scenes depicting virtual reality as a real, present-day and even prosaic technology.

description: A deal with Heirloom Carbon is one of the largest ever purchases of carbon-removal credits.

description: A looser labor market is necessary for inflation to go down and stay down.

description: Even with generous green subsidies, offshore wind projects are being called off as developers struggle to make a profit.

description: The Eurozone’s GDP grew just 0.1% from April to June, coming short of earlier estimates of 0.3% growth, as domestic consumption stagnated and exports weakened.

description: The country’s foreign-exchange reserves dropped in August amid a weakening yuan, according to People’s Bank of China data.

title: Feeble German Economy Faces Fresh Contraction as Factories Falter
description: Higher energy costs, competition from China and cooling global demand for goods are hobbling Europe’s industrial powerhouse.

title: Malaysia's Central Bank Stands Pat, as Expected
description: Malaysia’s central bank kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged, maintaining that its current monetary policy stance is in line with the country’s inflation and growth outlook.

title: China's Exports Fall for a Fourth Month
description: China’s exports to the rest of the world dropped for a fourth straight month in August.

title: Spain's 2030 Inflation-Linked Bond Shows No Concession Ahead of Auction
description: Spain’s 1.00% November 2030 inflation-linked bond, which will be tapped on Thursday, has been trading on the firm side lately, Citi said.

title: BAT Sells Russian, Belarusian Businesses
description: British American Tobacco sold its Russian and Belarusian businesses to a consortium led by members of BAT Russia’s management team for an undisclosed sum.

title: Glynn's Take: Lowe Exits RBA Bruised But Still Standing Tall
description: Outgoing Reserve Bank of Australia Gov. Philip Lowe used his last official speech urging monetary and fiscal policy makers to work together more closely to steer the economy, and defended his seven-year run at the helm.

title: German Industrial Production Falls More Than Expected
description: Germany’s industrial output declined 0.8% in July, further dampening hopes of a manufacturing rebound in the country as global demand for its goods weakens.

title: U.S., Allies Should Reduce Dependence on China, Speaker McCarthy Says
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said China’s Communist Party is to blame for businesses leaving the country and called on the U.S. to work with allies to reduce dependence on Chinese products.

title: Nestle to Buy Majority Stake in Grupo CRM
description: Nestle said it reached a deal with Advent International to acquire a majority stake in Grupo CRM for an undisclosed sum, in a bid to bolster its confectionery presence in Brazil.

title: Huawei Hits Back at Apple in China With New High-Speed Phone
description: With 5G-like speeds, the device is creating buzz among Chinese fans after Beijing banned the use of iPhones at some government offices.

description: Occupation authorities on the peninsula regularly parade “traitors” on camera, aiming to cow Kyiv-supporting residents into submission.

description: Flush with cash from an energy boom, Saudi Arabia and other Gulf monarchies eager for global influence are having their moment on the world’s financial stage.

title: Tech CEOs Want to Make a 'Super App.' Here's Why It's so Hard
description: Meta. PayPal. X. All of these companies have made attempts at building a “super app” in the U.S., following the success of WeChat in China. But they’ve struggled to combine functions like social media, messaging, payment into one place. Here’s why.
